body_html: I think we should merge this pretty much as is, perhaps the only change being to remove the DEBUG guards on that conversion. Even before this change, having users use Tensors/Variables from C++ was subject to segfaults because of the unchecked constructors. This change was never meant to address that. Instead, it was meant to make the conversion from Python<->C++ tensors consistent regardless of whether the static type in C++ is marked Tensor or Variable. This is needed to clean up several places in the JIT where we need to do list copies/static casts just to get pybind to cooperate. I agree that before we mark C++ Tensors non-alpha quality we need to make sure all the conversions are checked, but I don't think that has to be done in the same commit as these changes.
